  • City: CHICAGO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING CORROSIVE PACKAGE AT BAY 19. USING DECISION TREE FOR CORROSIVES AND PPE, RESPONDER CONTAINED THE LEAK AND PROCESSED IT THROUGH THE DMP. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED FOUR, ONE GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF WHICH ONE HAD A LOOSE CAP. ALL FOUR CONTAINERS WERE CONTAMINATED.

item.title: Report X-2024072268
item.description:
Report X-2024072268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO ONE AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO BEING LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE X 1.8 OUNCE FLAMMABLE CANS OF BANANA BOAT SPORT ULTRA CLEAR SUNSCREEN SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS MARKED COSMETIC DELIVERY AND INVOICE ENCLOSED.

item.title: Report E-2024070674
item.description:
Report E-2024070674

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T18:16:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: BRIDGEVIEW
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that four (4) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging four (4) plastic jugs. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify only four (4) jugs were damaged, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged boxes, jugs and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024070672
item.description:
Report E-2024070672

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T18:16:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1/2 a gallon of PPG PROLUXE PREMIUM DECK released from 1 gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The release impacted pallet only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
